intro: Senecio pampeanus f. pampeanus, commonly known as the Pampas senecio, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the temperate climates of the Pampas region. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
